page.title: 15DAVEY ROBERTSON'S DIALECT.
page.content: Davey Robertson is 80 years old.He used to live at Cassop,and he went to school where Newton's Garage is now. In 1919 he went to work down the pit as a Pony Putter,he looked after a pony called Chelsea,he fed it with jam and bread from his bait.He was our Lolly-pop man at Cassop school,every Christmas he dresses up as Father Christmas for the school parties. These are some of the dialect words that Davey uses. gan-go, tak-take, nee-no, faathur- father, claase-clothes, clarts-mud, bla-blow, netty-toilet, cracket-stool, stott-bounce, kest-throw, tother-other tommyacker-newt, spelk-splinter, ower-over, clemmy-large stone, scumfished-hot/uncomfortable, marra-mate, beor-beer, tyable-table, giz-give, taties-potatoes, snaggers-turnips, canny-all right.
